area_name: Short Chossy wall above the Matrix

content.description: This is the best route on the south face of this rock.  The rock isn't too chossy, and the movement is quite fun for a 25 foot route.  The crux is encountered at the slight bulge 3/4 of the way up the route where there are a couple of big moves between big holds.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 chain anchor with steel lowering biners.
content.location: Third route from the right side of the south face.

content.description: This route ascends the obvious rotten corner crack in the center of the wall.  I'm not sure if the crux was the steeper part at the top of the route or just trying not to kill my belayer with all of the rocks I pulled off.
content.protection: Bolts, 5ish to 2 chain anchor with steel lowering biners.
content.location: This is the fourth route coming from the right on the south face of the rock and is the only rotten corner crack on the wall.

content.description: This is the right most route on the wall (Please comment if you know the correct name or FA so that I can update it) .  The route starts out in a body sized dish like indent in the rock. The crux is encountered pulling out of this dish as there aren't a whole lot of feet and it is the steepest part of the route.  After that the route gets more and more slabby until you are climbing moss instead of rock from the last bolt to the anchors.  This is the least chossy route on the south face of this rock.
content.protection: bolts, maybe 5 to a 1 chain, 1 ring anchor.
content.location: The furthest right route, lowest angled as well.

content.description: This route straddles the super chossy rock to the right and the more solid rock to the left.  As with the two routes to the right of this one, the crux is not killing your belayer with the rocks you pull off.  This route is better than the three routes to the right of it, but not by a whole lot.
content.protection: bolts, 5ish to 2 bolt anchor with no chains, it is easy to lower off the anchors of the route to either side of it.
content.location: This route ascends the west facing section of the formation.  It is the third route left of the rotten corner crack, or 7th route from the right side of the formation.

climbs.name: The Pillar to the right of the chimney

content.description: This is a fun easy route for the kids on decent quality rock.  The crux is pulling over the one steep (i.e. almost vertical) section of rock between the first and second bolts.  Luckily, there is a juggy crack to the right that makes this steep section very easy, and other than that the route is pretty much just a scramble.
content.location: This route is on the east facing pillar that is just to the right of the obvious chimney with a route going up the back of it.

climbs.name: 2nd to the left of rotten corner crack

content.description: Another route on the rottenest rock I've ever climbed.  Like the route to the right of this one, the crux is not falling off when you pull your hand and foot holds off the wall and try not to kill your belayer.  As with the route to the right, I would treat the bolts as highly suspect, not because the bolts themselves are bad, but because I wouldn't be surprised if the whole section of wall that bolt is in came off under the load of a fall onto the bolt.
content.location: Second route to the left of the rotten corner crack, or the 6th route from the right side of the wall.  This route is located where the wall begins turning from south facing to west facing.

content.description: This is an okay route that ascends the less chossy rock on the right side of the formation.  This route is almost dead vertical, but there is a slight bulge at the top where the crux is encountered.  One of the better routes on the south face of this rock.
content.protection: 5ish bolts to a two chain anchor with lowering biners.
content.location: This is the second route from the right side of the south face of the rock.

climbs.name: 1st left of the rotten corner crack

content.description: This is a super chossy route in the worst rock on the wall.  I'd be seriously concerned that a fall would rip the bolt along with the section of the wall that the bolt is in right off the wall.  The crux of this route is most definitely trying not to kill your belayer with the big rocks that will be raining off the wall and keeping your balance/not falling when hand and foot holds blow on you.
content.location: This is the first route to the left of the rotten corner crack, or the 5th route from the right side of the wall.

pathTokens: Short Chossy wall above the Matrix
